moves.1. d4:
hello
this is going to be my first annotation and the first time that i played budapest gambit
don't know if i followed main line so i'd like a few comments on my play
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 e5 3. dxe5 Ng4 4. Nf3: i was kinda hoping he'll play Bf4 followed by Qe7 threatening Qb4  and attacking c-pawn and b pawn
moves.6. Be2 O-O: no need to take it yet
moves.7. O-O Re8:
now i like my position here
i developed 3 pieces while my opponent developed 2 of them
and my rook is controlling semi-opened file
moves.11... Nxf3+ 12. Qxf3: white has h1-a8 diagonal under control and i'll need a few moves to free my bishop
moves.13... Bb6 14. Bb2 d6: and my bishop is free at last
moves.15. Qg3:
now i have to deal with that g7 pawn
if he moves the knight, there's a checkmate threatening
moves.16. Ne4:
well, he moved it but luckily for me in the wrong place
blunder that cost him the game
moves.18. Bf6 Qf8: i didn't want to block my bishop again with Qd7and this way with my queen on f8 no need to worry about potential checkmate
moves.19... d5 20. Qg3 Be6 21. f4:
weakens his king for no reason
and look at that weak pinned e-pawn
moves.21... Re8 22. Kh2:
freeing the pawn...
but i think white is just losing time
moves.24... d4 25. Bh6 Qd6 26. Kh1 d3 27. Ra2: didn't want to exchange bishops and ease the pressure
moves.28. g4 Qd5+: and a nice combination leads to resining
moves.29. Kh2 Bxf4+ 30. Bxf4 Re2+:
he resigns because of:
31. Qg2#

the thing that allowed me to win this game is blunder on move 16 
please leave a comment, especially for first few moves
thanks ;)
have a nice day/week/month
